oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Dug relics recovered from Stewart's Landing (now East Bluff) in Meigs County
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Col. George McKenzie, 5th Tenn. Cav. Regt., CSA camped and skirimished near East Bluff (then Breedenton's Ferry) in Meigs County during the war. The dug relics are a mix of Civil War era minie bullets of .58 and .69 caliber as well as round balls and buckshot. Included is the side plate of an iron horse bit of a commond civilian style. Present are pieces of harness buckle covers, a woman's belt buckle, a pocket knife, a round iron buckle, a half dime from 1838, and buttons.
oai_dc:dc.dc:format: Tools and equipment; Weapons and ammunition; Clothing
